p: Flowers, leaves, and roots of V. calvum Boiss & Kotschy ( Figure 9) were separately collected on Halgurd mountain ( Figure 10) on June 19th, 2011; GPS position: 36°40′30.40”N, 44°50′7.40”E. The plant was identified by botanists A. H. Al-khayyat and Abdullah S. A. from the University of Salahaddin-Hawler/Iraq. A voucher specimen (No. VC 6823) has been deposited at the Salahaddin University herbarium (ESUH). The plant raw materials were air dried at room temperature for 10 days in a ventilated room, protected from light. After drying, the flowers were powdered by an electric mill grinder.
